meanings.definition: The quality of being unknown or difficult to understand.
meanings.sent1: The obscurities of the ancient text puzzled the scholars.
meanings.sent2: The obscurities in the research findings made it hard to draw conclusions.
meanings.sent3: The obscurities in the instructions led to a comical misunderstanding.
meanings.sent4: Navigating through the obscurities of life can be like finding a hidden treasure.
meanings.sent5: The obscurities of the night sky were revealed through the telescope's lens.

meanings.definition: Things that are unknown or difficult to understand.
meanings.sent1: She collected various obscurities from different cultures.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed rare obscurities from the past.
meanings.sent3: The box contained mysterious obscurities waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent4: The obscurities of the case were slowly unraveled by the detective.
meanings.sent5: The bookshop specialized in selling literary obscurities to curious readers.
